item.title: Quantifying and overcoming Darwinian shortfalls to conserve the fish tree of life
item.description: Abstract Knowledge shortfalls of the evolutionary history of bony fishes hamper phylogenetically informed conservation approaches. To direct future research efforts and phylogenetically based conservation actions, we calculated Darwinian shortfalls for taxonomic clades (genus, family and order-level) and countries, as well as derived a phylogenetic based prioritization metric for bony fishes. We built a synthesis phylogeny for 32,870 bony fishes using a global backbone phylogeny and inserting absent species by their taxonomic hierarchies (supertree approach).
